intro: Acinodendron aureoides, commonly known as the golden-leafed acinodendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its striking golden-yellow leaves and clusters of small white flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties. Acinodendron aureoides thrives in moist, shaded environments and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
